snippet: About 80 percent of people who chose plans under the Affordable Care Act are paying initial premiums as required, several large insurers said.
abstract: Several large insurers report that about 80 percent of people choosing plans under Affordable Care Act are paying initial premiums required for coverage to take effect; disclosure comes on eve of House hearing about law.
lead_paragraph: About 80 percent of people who chose plans under the Affordable Care Act are paying initial premiums as required, several large insurers said.

headline.main: Insurers Say Most Who Signed Up Under Health Law Have Paid Up
headline.print_headline: Insurers Say Most Who Signed Up Have Paid Up
